DIV1.P: EXTRACTS FROM THE ACCOUNT ROLLS OF THE ABBEY OF DURHAM, FROM THE ORIGINAL MSS.
Published for the Society BY ANDREWS & Co., DURHAM; WHITTAKER & Co., 2, WHITE HART STREET, PATERNOSTER SQUARE; BERNARD QUARITCH, 15, PICCADILLY; BLACKWOOD & SONS, EDINBURGH.

DIV2.HEAD: Compotus dnor. Will'i Graystanes et Joh'is Tynemouth Communiariorum Dunelm. a festo Sci. Romani Ep'i Anno D'ni Moccccmoxvjo usque ad festum Sce. Petro∣nille Virginis Anno D'ni Moccccmoxvijo.
DIV2.P: Rem. In primis iidem respondent nil de rem. ultimi compoti, ut patet in pede ejusdem.

Arr. Et de Dxixli. xjs. ijd. qa. de arr. xxxta annorum ante hunc compotum. Et de cciiijxxli. vs. jd. de arr. cantarie d'ni Rad'i de Nevill ante hunc compotum. Et de xxxiijli. xijs. qa. de arr. ultimi compoti precedentis, ut patet in pede compoti.
Summa, 833li. 8s. 3d. ob.

Redd. Ass. In primis, et de 20li. 13s. 5d. qa. rec. de redditu assise de term. Mart. infra hunc compotum; 13li. 12s. 8d. de terris et tenementis de novo impetratis de term. Mart.; 100s. de cantaria d'ni Radulfi Nevill de term. Mart.; 42s. 8d. de terr. et ten. pertinentibus ad cantariam d'ni Joh'is Fossour; 26s. de terr. et ten. pertin. ad cantariam d'ni Walteri Skirlawe.
Summa, 42li. 14s. 9d. qa.
Decime. In primis, et de 8li. rec. de medietate decime ecclesie de Bywell Petri; 53s. 4d. de dec. garbarum ville de Hett; 26s. 3d. ob. de dec. minere carbonum Thome de Blaykeston.
Summa, 11li. 19s. 7d. ob.
Pensiones ecclesiarum. Et de 10s. rec. de pens. eccl. de Walkyngton; et de 66s. 8d. de pens. eccl. de Siggeston per manus Rectoris ejusdem.
Summa, 76s. 8d.

Varie Recepte. Et de 10li. 12s. 6d. rec. de minera carbonum ville de Hett; 8s. 10d. de profect. curie et tolhale ville de Hett; nil de croppis et corticibus arborum per tempus compoti; 3s. pro reparac. tenementi quondam Will'i Homase in Wulleston.
Summa, 11li. 4s. 4d.

Summa totalis receptarum
preter arr., 69li. 15s. 4d. ob. qa.
cum arr., 903li. 3s. 8d. qa.

Empcio specierum. In primis, in superplus ultimi compoti precedentis, ut patet in pede ejusdem, 9li. 13s. 10d. qa.; Item in di. lb. gingebri, 20d.; di. lb. gariofolorum, 21d.; di. lb. piperis, 12d.; di. lb. de drage, 3d.; in nucibus muscatis, 6d.; in electuario pro noviciis, 12d.; in tribus lb. amigdalarum, 10d.; in 12 Ml. avelan. empt. cum cariagio, 7s. 1d.; in 1 barell separum empt., 12d.
Summa, 10li. 8s. 11d. qa.

Expense. In primis in 10 lb. candelarum albarum, prec. lb. 1d. ob., 15d.; in oblac. Supprioris ad Natale, 10s.; eidem pro elemosina, 2s.; in tribus celdris carbonum empt. pro domo communi, 5s. 6d.; clericis dicentibus psalteria in die Sancti Nicholai et per tempus compoti, 13s. 4d.; in 1 pietancia data conventui in die anniversarii d'ni Joh'is Fossour, 7s.; in tribus garniamentis emptis pro forestario, carpentario, et bateman, 22s.; in donis Communiarii causa officii, 6s. 3d. ob.; in expensis Supprioris et confratrum in domo communi et alibi, 5s. 9d. ob.; in donis datis operariis ex curialitate, 12d.; in expensis factis apud Hett pro curia teneda, 2s. 5d. ob.; in expensis Communiarii pro negociis domus, 7s. 8d.; in edificacione et reparacione tenementorum et aliarum reparacionum (sic) ut patet per papirum, 17li. 15s. 11d.; in donis datis carbonar. ex curialitate, 20d.; pro integra decima ecclesie de Siggeston, 6s. 8d.; pro contribucione facta ad consilium generale pro ecclesia de Bywell, 10d.; clerico scribenti compotum, citaciones, et alia pertinentia consistorio, 5s. 1d.; in seris emptis et emendatis, 11d. ob.; pro literis citatoriis missis ad diversas ecclesias pro firmis levandis, 18d.; in distribucione facta pro anima d'ni Walteri Skirlawe in die anniversarii ejusdem, 4s. 4d.; in duobus duodenis cirotecarum empt. et datis diversis causa officii, 2s. 10d.; in una capa empt. pro Suppriore, 13s. 4d.
Summa, 23li. 17s. 5d.

Pensiones et Stipendia. In primis, Precentori de term. Mart., 2s. 6d.; Succentori ad Natale, 2s.; Magistro Infirmarie ad Natale, 2s.; duobus Communiariis, 6s.; barbitonsori de term. Mart., 12d.; forestario de Hett, 3s. 4d., et bateman, 3s. 4d., 6s. 8d.; Communiario et scribenti missam de Trinitate, 3s. 4d.; lotrici Communiarii, 6d.; Camerario pro terris in Hett et pro pensione decimarum de Walkington, 13s. 4d.; Hostillario pro terris Willelmi Allman et Johannis Duresme, 3s.; Elemosinario pro terra Will'i Allman, 12d.; et nil pro terra in Trillesden, quia vasta; Sacriste pro 2 tenementis in Alvertongate, 3d.;
scaccario d'ni Episcopi pro terris quondam Joh'is Bam∣burgh, nil; ballivis burgi Dunelm. pro landemale, 2s. 1d. qa.; cantarie Beate Marie in ecclesia Beati Nicholai, 3s. 6d.; cantarie Thome Coxside in eadem, 20d.; cantarie beati Jacobi in eadem, nil; senescallo de Hett, 20d.; celebranti missam de Trinitate, 40s.; celebranti pro anima d'ni Walteri Skirlawe nuper Dunelm. Ep'i, 23s. 4d.; Bursario pro terris in Monketon, 13d.
Summa, 114s. 11d. qa.

Dona et Exennia. In primis in 1 exennio misso d'no Priori ludenti apud Beaurep', 10s.; in vino dato ibidem, 3s. 6d.; d'no Will'o Ebchester versus Oxon., 20d.; Cantori informanti juvenes in organis, 2s. 6d.; Ep'o Elemosinario, 2s.; cuidam armigero laboranti in miseria, ex curialitate, 20d.
Summa, 21s. 4d.
Soluciones fratrum. Prima solucio in festo Omnium Sanctorum, 9li. 3s.; secunda solucio in festo Purificacionis, 9li. 3s. 4d.; tercia solucio in festo Invencionis Sancte Crucis, 9li. 18d.
Summa, 27li. 7s. 10d.

Allocaciones et Condonaciones. In primis, in allocacione facta Rectori de Siggeston, 33s. 4d.; tenentibus Dunelm., Wulleston, et Fery, 3s. 9d.; tenent. ville de Hett, pro transgressione facta in bladis eorum per mineram, 3s. 7d.; Will'o White de Cletlam tempore vacacionis et implacita∣cionis, 16s. 4d. Item fecit allocacionem de 3s. 4d. solut. abbati de Alba landa pro libera firma tenementi in tenura Will'i Barton de term. Mart. (blank).
Summa, 61s. 4d.

Summa omn. expens., 71li. 11s. 9d. ob. Et sic excedunt recepta expensas in 831li. 11s. 1d. ob. De quibus se exonerat, In primis de 516li. 11s. 3d. de arr. 30ta annorum ante hunc compotum. Et de cciiijxxli. 5s. 1d. de arr. cantar. d'ni Rad'i de Nevill ante hunc comp. Et de 100s. de arr. dicti Rad'i de hoc anno. Et de 18li. 10s. 9d. qa. de arr. ultimi compoti precedentis. Et de 11li. 19s. 1d. qa. de arr. hujus compoti. Et de 55s. 8d. de decas. hujus comp. Et de 40s. 10d. de vast. hujus compoti.
Summa tocius exoneracionis, 837li. 2s. 8d. ob.
Et sic superexpendit, 110s. 9d. ob. qa.
Arr. hujus compoti. (Thirty entries, including, De scaccario Prioris pro terra in Herdwyk, 33s. 4d. De eodem pro Salve Regina, 50s.).

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. d'ni Rob. Seghowe, 1430-31.
DIV2.P: Arr. 3 annor. d'ni Thome Neesbitt; 1 anni d'ni Joh'is Royclyffe; 3 ann. d'ni Will'i Liham; 1 ann. d'ni Joh'is Oll; 1 ann. d'ni Georgii Syther; 1 ann. d'ni Rob'ti Moreby, ultimi Communiarii precedentis.

Soluciones. In prima solucione facta confratribus ad festum Sci. Petri ad Vincula, 10li. 6s.; et in secunda solucione facta eisdem ad festum Omnium Sanctorum, 10li. 8s. 4d. Et in tercia solucione facta eisdem ad festum Purif. B. Marie, 10li. 5s.
Summa, 30li. 19s. 4d.

Empcio specierum. In primis in 2 libr. de confectioni∣bus emptis, 3s. 4d. In ficubus et recemis emptis, 5s. In 6li. amigdalorum empt., 15d. Et in avelanis emptis, 8s. Et in 1 libr. zinziberis empt., 2s. 6d. Et in dragee et aliis speciebus emptis pro confratribus per tempus compoti, 4s. 1d. ob. Et in electuar. empt. pro noviciis, 7d. Et in cepis empt., 20d.
Summa, 26li. 5d. ob.
Expens. Coals for Common-house; white candles; et in cirpis emptis pro Domo Communi, 6d.; et in mundacione orti Communiarii, 2d., etc.

Pensiones et Stipendia. With others much as before, servienti apud cimbam monachorum, 6s. 8d.; in una pietancia solita dari conventui in obitu Joh'is Fossour, modo assignata ad sustentacionem vestimentorum altaris Sci. Nicholai, 10s.; et celebranti missam de Trinitate ad idem altare, 48s., etc.

Dona, etc. In primis in exenniis cum vino dato in duobus ludis d'ni Prioris racione Supprioris in eisdem ludentis, 27s. 7d. Et cantoribus erga Natale D'ni, 20d. Et in 1 pare cirotecarum dat. d'no Rob. Capellano de Wolveston, 8d. Et Gilberto Houden pro succisione meremii in Bieurepayr, 10d. Et in 1 duodena cirotecarum data ad festum Natalis D'ni servientibus et laborantibus pro officio, 18d. Et Episcopo puerili de Elemosina, 20d.
Summa, 33s. 11d.
Reparac. domorum. In exp. factis circa reparac. molendini de Hett et stagni ejusdem, 14s. 3d. ob. Et pro emendacione cimbe, 18s. 4d. ob.

DIV2.HEAD: c. 1440. A much decayed roll, all one side gone.
s.a. Do.
Comp. fr. Ric. Wrake, 1453-4.
DIV2.P: Var. Rec. De 22d. de incremento unius ten. et gardini sibi adjuncti in Clayporth ex opposito Crucis plumbei.
Empc. Specierum. Including 2 lb. del annez; 1 quart. del nootmogez; in confeccione vocat. lettorye fact. pro noviciis; in 1 soortt ficuum empt. cum cariagio, 12s. 6d.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. d'ni Joh. Danbe, 1474-5.
DIV2.P: Var. Rec. De 4li. rec. ex curialitate d'ni Prioris ad sustentacionem officii.
Emp. specierum. In jli. de sugreplate, 16d.; in 1li. et di. de lycorez, 7d.; in nutmugez et garriof., etc., 3s. 4d.; in uno sort ficuum empt. in Novo Castro cum cariagio, 16s.
Laborarii. In le dalbyng et le wyndyng interclose wallez, sydewallez, gawellez.
Arr. De Scaccario d'ni Prioris pro cantac' Salve Regina, 100s.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. d'ni Rob'ti Billyngham, 1480-81.
DIV2.P: Var. Rec. Pro croppez et corticibus nichil; de toll ale nichil; pro ficubus venditis, 18d.
Exp. nec. Pro 2 petr. picis, 16d.; 2 lagen. bituminis, 2s.; et di. petr. cebi, 16d.; (pro) flokkez et herdes, 4s. 8d.
(Cariagia, Laborarii, Carpentarii, Sarratores, Empcio calcis et tegularum, Tectura lapidea).

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. d'ni Joh. Hamsterley, 1489-90.
DIV2.P: Similar to the last.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. s.a. c. 1490. Much decayed.
Comp. d'ni Joh'is Porter, 1496-7.
DIV2.P: Exp. nec. In uno jentaculo facto ad curiam de Hett, 6s. 3d.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. s.a. c. 1500. Decayed at top.
DIV2.P: Empc. Specierum. 5 lib. confeccionum et 1 lb. de le sugerplayt, 3s. 6d.; 1 lib. licoricie, 4d.; in tribus tortis una cum servisia, 6s. 8d.; pro 3 le fralez ficuum, 11s., etc.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. d'ni Will'mi Dernton, 1505-6.
DIV2.P: Redd. Assis. 4li. 8s. 10d. rec. de terr. et redd. in Symondsyd pertinent. ad cantariam magistri Joh'is Rudd, assign. officio Communiarii per venerabilem patrem magistrum Joh'em Aukland, nuper Priorem Eccl. Cath. Dunelm. 20s. rec. de uno ten. in Sowthstrett juxta capellam Sce. Margarete assign. (etc., ut supra) 40s. rec. de divers. terr. et ten. in Hebbarne nuper Johannis Wille assign. (etc., ut supra).
Carpent. et Sarratores. Sol. pro lez crobbyng of 2 breweleides et nayllyng of yam, 2s.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. d'ni Joh'is Ryddall, 1508-9.
DIV2.P: Exp. nec. 4 uln. panni de lez hardyn empt. pro scaccario, 12d.; in cirpis empt. pro Domo Communi et scaccario, 8d.; in 3 pare crubbes, 18d.; pro reparacione simbe monachorum cum pice et bitumine, 3s. 4d.; et in una cena data noviciis in prima rasura, 6s. 6d.
Dona et exennia. Pro factura unius chist', 4d.
Laborarii. Operant. circa emendacione de lez botstede per 6 dies.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. d'ni Rob'ti Wardell, 1510-11.
DIV2.P: Empcio Specierum. The usual kind of entries; (including 1 lib. licoric', 4d.) Et in aliis speciebus empt. per idem tempus compoti, una cum servicia et quinque magnis tortis, 6s. 10d. Et in quinque lez toppettis racemorum parvorum ad 2s. 8d.; et pro cariagio eorundem, 16d., 14s. 8d. Et in electuario facto pro noviciis, 4s. 3d.

Exp. nec. Et sol. Joh'i Elyngton de Novo Castro pro quinque petr. picis empt. pro cimba, prec. unius petr. ad 10d., 4s. 2d. Et pro cariagio ejusdem a Novo Castro usque Dunelm., 8d. Et sol. Joh'i Couper operanti per 4or dies pro emendacione prefate cimbe ad 6d. per diem, 2s. Et pro
bitumine, 4d. Et sol. pro le tyngylnalles, 6d. Et pro le towe, 3d. ob. Et sol. pro novis remis factis pro cimba, cum cariagio eorum, 3s. 6d.
Dona et exennia. Et pro factura trium sistarum, 12d.

Cariagium. Et in expens. unius nove domus noviter edificate in tenemento Will'i Wawton in Claporth que funditus coruit in diebus d'ni Joh'is Ryddall, tunc temporis Communiarii. In primis sol. Rob'to Toller et Rogero Marshall pro emundacione prefate domus, operantibus per duos dies et di. cap. per diem inter se 6d., 15d. Et sol. Ric'o Robynson pro cariagio 13 plaustrat. pulverum meremii corrupti, de le thacke et wrak existent. in eadem domo usque ad latus Wire ad 1d. ob., 21d.; (carriage of stones, etc., from the quarry of Browne, including) 7 plaustrat. meremii a parca vicina usque ad domum W. W. in Clayporth at 8d., 4s. 8d.
Carpentarii et Sarratores. Operant. in explanacione meremii pro una domo W. W. in Clayporth; pro calebe, et emendacione unius lez spyndyll molendini de Hett.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1511-12.
DIV2.P: Empcio Specierum. In primis, sol. Joh'i Blund pro quinque lib. confeccionum et le suggurplatt ad 7d., 4s. 1d. Et sol. pro notmoggez, gariofolis, croco, et rasinis corent., 2s. Et in clowys et mace, 16d. Et in 4 lib. de annesedis, 16d. Et in pipere, 8d. Et in licoricia, 6d. Et in tribus quarteris zinzibri, 18d. Et in 5 tortis, cum cervisia, 7s. 10d. Et sol. Joh'i Brandlyng de Novo Castro pro 5 fralez ficuum ad 3s. 4d., 16s. 8d. Et in 4or le tapettes racemorum magnorum ad 2s. 8d., 10s. 8d. Et in electuaria eorundem, 20d. Et in sepis emptis de Hugone Spark, Georgio Nicholl, et de aliis per idem tempus compoti, 2s. 10d. Et in una cena noviter facta confratr., 3s. 8d. Et in electuaria facta pro noviciis, 3s. 8d.
Summa, 58s. 5d.

Expens. necess. Pro 6 celdris carbonum et pro cariagio; pro 3 celdr. carb. cum car.; pro 4or plaustratis focalium vectis a silva de Hett usque ad Domum Com∣munem; in 16 lib. candelarum albarum (etc.) pro uno magno lez huppe facto pro molendino de Hett, 16d.; pro reparacionibus cori ecclesie Sci. Petri de Bywell (plumbing and glazing).
Dona et Exennia. Sol. diversis portantibus ferinam Suppriori et Conventui, 5s. 4d. Et in obitu dompni Thome Durham, 10s. Et pro factura unius ciste, 4d.

Carriagium. Pro cariagio 8 plaustrat. meremii, viz. pro lez framyde tymber, vectis a capite de Elwett usque ad locum domorum ejusdem vici ad 2d., 16d.; pro 2bus plaustratis meremii vectis a Claporth usque ad lez boytstede ad 3d., 6d.

Laborarii. Facientibus muros, hallandes, et dalbyng∣warke; in plachyngwarke; pro le thachyng unius domus; pro situacione unius lez brewleyde; pro purgacione unius tenementi in Sowthestrett quondam Thome Chamer, 8d.

Sarratores. Sol. Thome Lottes pro 2bus lignis emptis ab eo pro cistis confratrum These entries explain the "chests" (coffins) mentioned under this head in previous years. et sepulturis eorundem, 3s. 4d. Et pro sarratura earundem, viz. unius rod. et di., 4s. 6d.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1513-14 (Fragment).
DIV2.P: Var. Rec. De corticibus et de le croppys hoc anno, nil, nec de le tollale.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. dompni Radulphi Blaxton, 1516-17.
DIV2.P: Empcio Specierum. In . . speciebus . . una cum pane et servisia, 6s. 2d. In electuar. fact. pro noviciis, 3s. 4d. In cepis emptis in foro, 2s. 8d.

Dona et exennia. Sol. diversis portantibus ferinam conventui, 5s. 4d.; sol. in obitu d'ni Henrici Dawson et d'ni Rob. Standroppe, 20s. Et pro factura cistarum eorundem, These entries explain the "chests" (coffins) mentioned under this head in previous years. 8d. Et sol. d'no Wylli'o Wylome, d'no Wyll'mo Hulome, et d'no Stephano Merlay versus Oxon., 10s.
Laborarii. Pro purgacione unius ten. in Elvett de le thak et wrak existent. in eadem domo; operantibus super le wolt in orto Communiarii; pro purgacione unius le wast in Framwelgate.
Carpentarii et Serrat. Operantibus super le wolt in orto Communiarii.

DIV2.HEAD: Status Officii Communiarii Dunelm. deliberatus Dompno Richardo Heryngton per dompnum Radulphum Blaston, nuper Communiarium ejusdem, Ao D'ni Millesimo cccccxvijo.
DIV2.P: In primis, duo salsaria argentea unius secte cum uno cooperculo, quondam Joh'is Gatysheud, ponderantia 21 unc. 3 quart. et di. Item, 1 stondyng cope cum cooperculo et parcell gylt, ponderant. 17 unc. Item 1 crathera cum una rosa sculpta in fundo et parcell gylt, ponderant. 12 unc. Item 1 crathera unius secte sine cooperculo, cum hac diccione, etc., Communiario, sculpta in fundo ejusdem, ponderant. 16 unc. Item 1 crathera sine cooperculo cum armis cujusdam d'ni sculptis in fundamento, ponderant. 9 unc. Item, 1 platter pro speciebus, 18 unc. 1 quart. Item 1 pixis pro speciebus et deauratus circa fundum, et citra medium cis quadrum, script. cum gallicis literis et deaurat. in fundo, 3 unc. et di. qr. Item 12 coclearia argentea cum Communiario sculpt. super dorsa, 16 unc. Item 18 parapsides, 13 disci, et 15 salsaria de le pewder, et 3 chargers de ligno pict. Item 18 disci lignei pro ficubus. Item 12 scissoria. Item 2 manutergia pro locione ante prandium, et 5 mappe cum 4or manutergiis pro eisdem, et octo parve napkyns. Item 1 mura et 3 pelves cum 2 lavacris. Item duo candelabra cum floribus, et 1 amphora. Item 1 mensa cum 2 tripedis. Item 3 forme. Item 2 ciste et una pro candelis conservandis. Item 1 magna le almery. Item 2e capse cum evidenciis, que sunt in cancellaria. Item 2 capsile, et 1 le bankor de diversis coloribus. Item 2 sedilia, et duo dorsaria assignata cum canibus. Item 1 bankor et 6 pulvinaria. Item 2 cathedre, et 1 morteriolum eneum cum 1 pila ferrea. Item 1 platella pro electuario, cum 1 ypopurgio. Item 1 calefactorium. Item 2 rentallia et unum de redditibus annualibus, alterum de cantariis Waltheri Skyrley et Joh'is Forssor. Item 2 canille ferree. Item 1 pike de ferro. Item 1 vertibulum cum tribula de ferro. Item evidencie extracte in quodam libro scripto per d'nm Joh'em Porter seniorem. Item 1 cawterium pro vasis signandis. Item 4or sere nove cum clavibus. Item Cma brodnales. Item c bordnale. Item 1 cimba cum 2 remis. Item 1 sera cum clave et cum 1 cathena pro eadem cimba. Item in domo stauri in Crosgate, 5 plaustrat. calcis. Item 2 plaustrat. tegularum. Item cccc lattes. Item 1 rudd de sawne bordes. Item ad puteum de Hett, in primis, 1 restis et 1 cruke de ferro. Item 2 pykes, 2 trammys, et 2 shulys.

Diversa vasa pertinencia officio Communiarii ad diversa tenementa in Dunelm. In primis, in Ballio Australi ad ten. Joh'is Barnard, 1 brewleyd, 1 tapstone, Cf. Rot. Hostill., 1456-7, p. 151, where for "capstane" read "tapstane." et 1 stepleyd. Item in Boriali ad ten. Joh'is Nycholson, 1 brewleyd et tapstone. Item ad ten. Joh'is Cowper in Sadlergate, 1 brewleyd, 1 tapstone et 1 stepleyd. Item ad ten. Wi Spynke in Fleshergatt, 1 brewled et 1 tapstone. Item ad ten. Joh'is Hall, 1 brewleyd. Item ad ten. Edwardi Jonson in Claporthe, 1 brewleyd et 1 tapston. Item ad ten. d'ni Joh'is Swayn, 1 brewleyd, 1 tapstone, 1 culynge leyd, et stepeleyd. Item ad ten. Thome Potter, 1 brewleyd and tapstone. Item ad ten. Ric. Gray, 1 brewleyd et 1 tapstone. Item ad ten. Alani Hunter, 1 brewleyd et 1 tapstone. Item ad ten. Wi Wawton, 1 brewleyd, 1 tapstone, et stepeleyd. Item ad ten. Thome Yettes, 1 brewleyd et 1 tapstone. Item ad ten. Joh'is Smalwod, 1 brewleyd et 1 tapston. Item ad ten. Laurencii Toller in Sowthstrette, 1 brewleyd, 1 tapstone, 1 stepeleyd, and 1 culyng leyd.
Summa de Brewleydes, 15.
Summa de tapstones, 11 Read 14..
Summa de stepeleydes, 5.
Summa de culyng leydes, 2.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. dompni Ric'i Herryngton, 1517-18.
DIV2.P: Exp. nec. Sol. pro cena illis qui erant rasuri in crastino, 4s. 7d.

Dona et exennia. Cantoribus ludentibus (in) Infir∣maria, 20d.; portantibus ferinam; servo Leonardi Morton de Berwyke pro 16 hundreth hosters, in regardo, 2s. pro Subpriore et Conventu. Et in obit. d'nor. Will'mi Ogle, Thome Gatisheued et Roberti Wille, 30s. Et sol. pro factura duarum cistarum, 8d.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. dompni Ric'i Wheldayne, 1524-25.
DIV2.P: Three copies, marked respectively, Pars d'ni Prioris, Pars Supprioris, and Pars Communiarii.
Remanenc. Nulla.
Redd. Assis. From various tenements and lands in the city and county of Durham; some are for chantries; those of John Fossur, Walter Skerley, John Bude, are mentioned.
94li. 23¾d.
Decime. From Bywell St. Peter's and Hett, and of certain coals.
9li. 7s. 2d.
Pensiones. From Walkington, Seggiston, Byland Abbey, and nuns of Newcastle.
8li. 3s. 4d.
Varia Recepta. Sundry rents of tenements and lands; de corticibus, 4s.; de minera carbonum ibidem (Hett), 2s.
3li. 6s. 8d.
Total, 114li. 18s. 9¾d.

Soluc. firm. Soluc. firm. fact. fratribus ad fest. S. Petri ad Vincula, 9li. 7s. 8d.; ad fest. Omn. Sanctorum, 9li. 2s. 8d.; ad fest. Purif. B. V. M., 9li. 2s. 8d.; ad fest. Inv. S. Crucis, 9li. 2s. 8d.

Empciones specierum. 6 lib. confectionum ad 8d., 4s.; 2 lib. de suger plate, 16d.; 6 lib. licoris, 2s.; di. lib. piperis, 14d.; 6 lib. annes, 2s.; dim. lib. zinzabri, 20d.; 1 quart. lib. croci, 16d.; 1 quart. lib. masse et clowes, 2s. 8d.; notmoges, 6d.; 4½d. lib. racemorum, 14d.; in aliis speciebus una cum servicia et sex magnis tortis, 12s. 10d.; 6 frayles ficuum, 24s.; 2 frayles razemorum, 11s. 10d.; in cepis empt. in foro, 3s.; et in electuar. fact. pro monachis, 6s.

Penciones et stipendia. Precentori, 5s.; Succentori, 2s.; Magistro Infirmarii, 2s.; Communiario, 12s.; eidem Communiario pro collectione firmarum, et Succentori pro tabulacione cantarie d'ni Joh. Fossure, 6s. 8d.; custodi cimbe monachorum, 6s. 8d.; una toga pro eodem, 5s.; celebranti miss. ad cantariam d'ni Walteri Skirlowe Episcopi Dunelm., 40s.; cel. miss. ad. cant. d'ni Joh. Fossur Prioris Dunelm., 48s.; in distribucione facta
pauperibus in die anniversarii d'ni Walt. Skyrlowe, 2s.; cel. miss. ad cant. magistri Joh. Rudde, 48s.; lotrici cum smigmate, 2s.; custodi silve de Hette, 6s. 8d.; senesc. ten. curiam apud Hette, 3s. 4d.; pro pergameno, papiro, et scribenti hunc compotum, 2s. 8d. pro blank dyme d'no Regi pro ecclesia de Seggeston.

Dona et Exennia. In ludis d'ni Prioris et Conv. in quatuor ludis ordinariis, senescallo in eisdem ludis, 40s.; in vino dato Priori et extraniis, 30s. 10d.; cantoribus ludentibus (in) Infirmaria, 20d.; (expenses of collecting pension, tithe, etc.), in 12 par cerothecarum dat. diversis laborantibus pro utilitate officii, 12d.; portanti firmam Suppriori et Conventui, 7s. 2d.; in obbitu dompni Roberti Tode, 10s.; pro factura unius ciste, 4d.
5li. 3s. 4d.
Redd. Resol. Including landmale, and "comiti Westmerl." pro lib. redd. j tenementi in Cletlam pro j lib. cimini, 4d.
6li. 3s. 9¼d.

Expens. Necessar. In oblac. dat. Suppriori erga fest. Natalis D'ni, 10s.; eidem in elemosina facienda, 2s.; in expens. laborancium in patria diversis vicibus et apud Cletlam, Standrop, Novum Castrum, Siggiston, et alibi, 4s.; pro 9 celd. carbon. ad puteum de Fenkhall, 6s.; et ten. de Schinikley pro cariagio eorundem, 7s. 4d.; tenentibus de Hett pro car. 8 plaustr. focalis vect. a silva de Hett usque ad Domum Communem ad 10d., 6s. 8d.; pro 26 lib. candelarum albarum ad 2d., 3s. 4d.; (12 locks and keys and mending; locks, keys, doorband, brodnails, bordnails, durecroks, durbandes, hespis et staples per tempus com∣poti; 3 doorbands and 24 nails for water mill at Hett, cleaning and mending milldam, laths made in Hett wood, mending a brewlead, wandes and stowres), pro feno expend. in tectura domorum et caminorum, pro jantaculo apud Hett facto in die curie ibidem, 7s.; diversis portanti∣bus firmam ad scaccariam, 2s.; (spiking nails, tingilnails, leadnails, repairs of a brewlead, solder, new lead, casting a cistern, new lead and solder, staples, wattles, and rods); pro tribus le crokis pro uno brewled, 9d.
6li. 9s. 1d.

Cariag. Tenentibus de Hett pro car. 15 plaustr. meremii ab silva de Hett predicta usque Dunelm. ad 10d., 12s. 6d.; ten. de Schynklay pro car. 6 plaustr. lapid. a quarrera Sacriste Dunelm. ad domum Henrici Watson ad 4d., 2s.; pro car. 62 plast. luti ad 3d., 15s. 6d.; pro car. 8 plaustr. calcis ad le storehowse (et) ad diversa ten. ad 3d., 2s.; pro car. 12 plast. sabili ad le storehowse et alia tenementa; car. calcis, de le thake a Ravynisflatte ad tenementa in Elvet, meremii ad le storehowse ad tene∣mentum; meremii a fine de Elvett ad eandem domum; pro car. 10 plaustr. focalis ad Domum Communiarii, 8 plaustr. tegularum ad le storehowse, servo Sacriste Dunelm. pro car. 3 plaustr. de lyng et pro le pullyng ejusdem, 5s. 8d.; tenentibus de Hett pro car. de le lattis, 2s.
3li. 8s. 2d.

Laborarii. Pro purgacione unius tenementi in Fleschewergate, thake et wrake exist. in eodem cum car. operant. per 20 dies, 10s.; pro muracione et dalbura murorum (men at similar work and those serving them, names all given).
5li. 8s. 7d.
Carpent. et Cerrat. Carpenters' work; factura hostiarum et fenistrarum; pro 5 rudd meremii et pro serracione 4 rud et di. bordarum cont. 19 ulnis; pro serracione 20 bordarum, 17d.; further sawing.
Empcio tegular. et calcis. (Et car.).
Tectura lapidea et straminea. Pro tectura lapidea; pro punctuacione; pro tectura straminea; pro le drawyng de le thake; (for tenements).
Allocaciones. To rector of Segyston, 6li. 13s. 4d.; certain sums named above as received by him for rents, but now in hands of Bursar; rentcharge payable to nuns of Newcastle; for a tenement.
Total, 94li. 12s. 11d.
Arreragia. Rents, decasus, vasta, vasta per defectum tenencium.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. dompni Joh'is Browne, 1534-5 (unfinished).
DIV2.P: Redd. Assis. Streets mentioned are, Ballium Australe, Ballium Boriale, Sadlergat, Flesshergat, Claporth, North∣raw, Southraw, Gelygat, Alvertongat, Crosgat, Southstrett, Mylneburnegatt, Lymekylgat, Vetus Elwett, Framwelgat.

DIV2.HEAD: A roll without legible name; date seems to be 1537.
DIV2.P: (Too much decayed and faded to afford any informa∣tion).

DIV2.HEAD: Compotus fratris Willelmi Barry Terrarii Dunelm. a festo Pentecostes Anno Domini Millesimo Quadringentesimo primo usque idem festum Anno Domini, etc., revoluto.
DIV2.P: Arr. In primis, idem respondet de 14li. 5s. 6d. ob. de arr. ultimi compoti anni precedentis, ut patet in pede ejusdem.
Summa (blank).

Recepta. Et de 24s. 10d. recept. de villa de Over∣heworth; 4s. de villa de Nethirheworth; 6s. 8d. de bras. Brasinagio, 1414-15. ejusdem ville; 22s. de villa de Muncton; 2s. de bras. ejusd. ville; 60s. 5d. de villa de Harton; 6s. 8d. de bras. ejusd. ville; 16d. de villa de Hethworth; 15d. de villa de Wyuestowe; 3s. 4d. de bras. e. v.; 16s. de v. de Walleshend; 2s. de bras. e. v.; 2s. de bras. de Willyngton; 27s. 8d. de v. de Suthwyk; 8s. de bras. e. v.; 7s. 4d. de v. de Wermouth; 12s. de bras. e. v.; 20d. de v. de Fulwell; 2s. de bras. e. v.; 13s. 10d. de v. de Westraynton; 2s. 8d. de Metrid de Methredo, 1416-17. de Estraynton et Westraynton; 2s. de bras. v. de Estraynton; 6s. 8d. de bras. v. de Pittyngton; 36s. de v. de Hesilden; 2s. de bras. e. v.; 39s. 4d. de v. de Coupon; 39s. 4d. de v. de Billyngham; 2s. 5d. ob. de v. de Wolveston; 40s. de bras. tocius parochie de Billyngham; 17s. 8d. de v. de Fery; 22s. de bras. e. v.; 6s. 6d. de v. de Estmeryngton; 13s. 4d. de bras. e. v.; 6s. 8d. de manerio e. v.; 30s. 10d. de v. de Midmeryngton; 7s. 2d. de v. de Westmeryngton; 12d. de v. de Aclyff; 6s. 8d. de bras. e. v.; 3s. 4d. de bras. v. de Dalton; 3s. 4d. de manerio ejusd. ville; 20s. de manerio de Hesilden; 6s. 8d. de manerio de Estraynton; 20s. de manerio de Belassise; 66s. 8d. de agistamento del Holme; 24s. de prato Terrarii; et de 24s. rec. de Billyngham et Coupon pro cartsilver.
Summa omnium rec. (blank).

Expense. In primis, pro expensis factis apud Novum Castrum pro tractatu habendo cum executoribus W. Johnson pro terris in Wermouth, 3s. 8d. Item in uno yetlyng empto pro manerio de Beulieu, 3s. 4d.; in solucione facta Will'o Dycon, carpentario, pro reparacione del hogcote apud Holme, 4s. 8d.; pro senapio empto in villa et in patria per tempus compoti, 8s. 2d.; in exp. factis in Wardall diversis vicibus, 7s. 2d.; in una cuculla empta pro Terrario, cum factura ejusdem, 7s. 4d.; in solucione facta custodi de Ferycliff pro stipendio suo, 3s. 4d.; pro lucracione del hekstaures pro le Holme, 12d.; in soluc. facta Sacriste Dunelm. pro togis emptis clericulis in ecclesia, 17s. 6d.; in sol. facta clerico Infirmarie, 3s. 4d.; in sol. facta Thome Langton pro pensione sua, 66s. 8d.; in sol. facta d'no Ep'o pro quadam clausura in Wardall, 4s.; in sol. facta pro expensis Halmotorum per annum, 39s. 2d.; pro diversis expensis factis in patria per Ric'm Pollard, 3s. 6d.; in emendacione staboli Terrarii, cum plaunchours et aliis necessariis, 2s. 6d.; in reparacione et emendacione cujusdam ten. in Wolveston, 32s.; in sol. facta Granatario ex consuetudine, 3s. 4d.; Thome Mayson pro fossis factis in Beurepaire, 5s.; in reparacione cujusdam bercarie apud le Byrkhous in Wardall, 26s. 8d.; in sol. facta cocis in die Pasche ex curialitate, 20d.; Thome Tesedall pro factura diversarum clausarum in Beurepair, 6s. 8d.; in diversis expensis factis in patria diversis vicibus per tempus compoti, 10s. 10d.; in donis datis diversis ad Natale et aliis temporibus, 12s. 6d.; in solucione facta Ric'o Pollard pro stipendio suo, 26s. 8d.; in recompen∣sacione facta pro le lak pecunie predicte, 4s.; sol. pro vitriacione cujusdam fenestre in le Shavynghous, 12d.; in sol. facta Priori de Coldyngham pro ovibus ab eodem emptis, 6li. 10s.; in sol. facta bercario apud le Holme pro stipendio suo, 6s. 8d.
Summa omnium expens., 22li. 2s. 4d.
Summa totalis recept. cum arr., 48li. 10s. 10d.
Et sic excedunt rec. expens. in 26li. 8s. 6d.
De quibus se exonerat de 2s. de bras. ville de Willyngton, etc., etc.
Summa totalis exoneracionis, 27li. 3d.
Et sic superexpendit 11s. 9d.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1414-15.
DIV2.P: Rec. Summa, 39li. 9s. 5d. ob.

Expense. In primis, in solucione facta Joh'i Noblett pro adquisicione carbonum apud Heworth, 6s. 8d. In sol. facta pro una sella empta pro Terrario, 15s.; pro junctur' empt' cum aliis necessariis, 4s.; in expens. versus Coldyng∣ham et ibidem, 10s.; in sol. facta Thome Langton pro pensione sua, 66s. 8d.; Edwardo Horneby pro stipendio suo, 26s. 8d.; in expens. apud Raby diversis vicibus, 2s. 9d. ob.; in exp. fact. diversis servientibus per maneria et alibi, 3s. 4d.; in exp. fact. versus Middelham in Coverdale, 3s. 1d.; in emendacione unius calicis pro Halmot, 4s.; in una cuculla empta cum factura, 8s.; clerico Infirmarie, 3s. 4d.; in emendacione vie apud le Stotteȝate, 12d.; custodi de Feryclif pro rewardo suo, 3s. 4d.; in donis datis ad Natale et aliis diversis vicibus, 9s. 10d.; in solucione facta Sacriste pro togis clericorum ecclesie, 20s.; lotrici Terrarii, 2s.; in expens. Halmotorum per annum, 51s. 3d.; in expens. in patria et apud Novum Castrum diversis vicibus, 19s. 6d.; pro medicinis equorum, 18d.; Joh'i Hyndeley egrotanti, ex curialitate, ex precepto Prioris, 3s. 4d.; uni tenenti de Sheles capto per Scottos, 20d.; in senapio empto in villa et in patria, 8s.; in emendacione stangni molendini de Shelez, 12s. 2d.; in donis datis cocis die Pasche ex curialitate, 20d.; Granatario ex consuetudine, 3s. 4d.
Summa, 14li. 12s. 1d. ob.
Excedunt Rec. Exp. in 24li. 17s. 4d.
Summa Exon., 18li. 14s. 2s. ob.
Et sic exced. Rec. Exp. in 6li. 4s. 1d. ob., que summa liberatur ad facturam Librarie.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1416-17.
DIV2.P: Rec. 39li. 9s. 5d. ob.

Expense. In primis, in tonsione ovium apud le Holme, 18d.; in sol. fac. Coronatori pro filio Johannis Shepehird submerso, 5s.; pro dimid. quart. ordii empt. et dato pre∣dicto Johanni, 2s. 8d.; sol. Edwardo pro servicio suo, 26s. 8d.; sol. I. Pudsay armigero pro equo suo mortuo in Beurepair, 10s.; pro toga estivali empt. Edwardo, 10s.; in elemosina dat. diversis tenentibus captis per Scotos, 4s. 4d.; pro uno equo ambulanti empto de Ricardo Denom, 46s. 8d. Item pro fugacione ij pullorum versus Cleveland et Merewode, 14d.; pro lucracione del hekstaves pro ovibus in le Holme, 14d.; Roberto Horneby versus Oxon.,
3s. 4d.; pro vasis de stanno empt. pro manerio de Wyuestow, 7s.; in j flaket empto pro senapio cariando in patria, 10d. With other usual or less notable entries.
Summa, 21li. 17s. 1d.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1417-18.
DIV2.P: Rec. 39li. 9s. 5d. ob.

Exp. Pro quatuor togis emptis clericulis in ecclesia, 18s. 8d.; pro staures emptis pro shepehekkys apud le Holme, 16d.; pro 1 case empt. pro cocliaribus argent. cariandis, 6d.; Roberto Cok pro emendacione pavimenti in choro ecclesie de Alverton, 20s.; pro juncturis emptis, (cum) uno freno, 18d.; pro cooportura unius selle, 20d.; Joh'i Acliff pro medecinis oculorum suorum, 3s. 4d.; in expensis Edwardi per patriam, 3s. 4d. (etc.).
Summa exp., 23li. 17s. 10d.

Exp. In primis, in expens. apud Biewliew in tonsione ovium, 18d.; in uno caase pro coclearibus argent. inpo∣nendis, 6d.; Roberto Cok ad facturam pavimenti in choro de Allerton, 20s.; pro 1 coopertorio unius selle et emenda∣cione ejusdem, 2s. 2d.; in solucione facta cuidam medico pro cura sua circa oculos d'ni Joh'is Aclif, 3s. 4d.; in staurez empt. pro le shephekkez apud le Holme, 16d.; in factura unius collistridii apud Billyngham, 20d. (etc.).
Summa, 22li. 19s. 4d.

Exp. In donis dat. Roberto Harebotili visitanti parentes suos, 20d.; sol. ad construccionem de le ale The alley; "vie" 1414-15. juxta le Stotyate, 12d.; sol. pro 1 curru empt. Joh. Shepard del
Holme, 11s.; pro factura 1 caroll in claustro, 6s. 8d.; pro fugacione ovium usque Wardall et le Holme, 12d.; pro factura cujusdam pontis apud le Holme, 7s. 8d. (etc.).
Summa, 23li. 19s.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. Will'i . arr, The first letter is illegible. 1421-2.

Expense. In primis, in expensis factis versus Werk∣worth pro negocio filii Baronis de Hilton, 2s. 9d. ob.; in exp. f. v. Rectorem de Wenselaw pro negociis domus, 18d. ob.; in construccione unius caroll in claustro, 13s. 4d.; pro factura unius pontis apud le Holme, 6s. 6d.; pro expensis versus Ebor. ad loquend. cum Ep'o Dunelm., 8s. 1d.; pro cariacione feni ad le Overdeyhous, 4s.; pro reparacione cujusdam cimbe apud Bonyfery ex curialitate, 20d.; d'no Will'o Ebchestre pro incepcione Bacalariatus, 6s. 8d.; operariis ad viam juxta Elvetwode ex cur., 14d.; uni fratri predicatori de Hibernia ex precepto Prioris, 12d.; pro emendacione murorum apud le hogcote juxta le Holme, 16d.; pro reparacione cujusdam barcarie apud le Westyate juxta Edmondbires, 36s. 8d. (etc.).
Summa, 20li. 10s. 9d. ob.

DIV2.P: Rec. 30li. 18s. 7d. ob.

Expense Terrarii. Rob'to Foster del Haynyng pro colleccione argenti Terrarii in Weralshir, 4s.; collectori arg. terr. in Billinghamshir, 3s. 4d.; in panno laneo empt. pro pueris ecclesie, 16s.; in vino dato in ludis Prioris, 4s. 2d.; in pipere et croco empt., 2s. 6d.; Philippo Smyth facienti signa ferr. pro animalibus signandis, 14d.; famulo Thome Lyes portanti exennia Priori, 8d.; famulo d'ni Radulphi Gray, militis, portanti ferinam, 12d.; in ostreis emptis, 4d.; pro reparacione vie versus Sunderlandbrig, 12d.; cocis d'ni Episcopi ad festum Pasche, 3s. 4d.; cocis d'ni Prioris ad idem festum, 2s.; in reparacione facta apud Nethirdeihouse in Beaurpark, ut patet per parcellas in papiro compt, 43s. 7d. (etc.).
Summa, 22li. 9s. 4d. ob.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1426-7.
DIV2.P: Rec. 31li. 18s. 7d. ob.

Expens. Capellano d'ni Ep'i celebranti primam missam, 6s. 8d.; in 1 pari cultellorum empt. pro uxore Thome Langton, 3s. 4d.; in vino dulci, wardons, et ostreis, datis uxori Thome Langton, 2s. 6d.; in emenda∣cione unius columbar' apud Raynton, 22d.; Hugoni Sclater operanti super cameram Terrarii, 7s. 7d.; carpentario oper. super eandem cameram, 2s. 11d.; Willelmo Hoggeson de Harton pro sustentacione unius husband ibidem, 10s.; Thome Evenwode de Wolveston pro sust., etc., 10s.; in solucione facta d'no Archiepiscopo Ebor. pro installacione sua, 60s.

Langton ex curialitate, 3s.; Thome del Hall pro 1 rete empt. ad capiend. feras apud Mugliswyk, 3s. 4d.; portanti ferinam Priori a Willelmo Wilberfos, 12d.; reparac. unius pontis voc. Chapmanbrig, 3s. 4d.; ad fabricam Infirmarie, 40s.; in pluveriis empt. pro Priore, 12d. (etc.).

Exp. Terr. In primis in expensis ejusdem Terrarii equitantis diversis vicibus versus Aukland, Raby, Stokton, Billingham, Mugliswyk, et alia loca diversa per tempus compoti,1 18s. 10d.; pro reparacione janue novi pontis in Dunelm. ex precepto Episcopi et Prioris, 6s. 8d.; in expensis Terrarii, Magistri Will'i Doncastr', Joh'is Holme, et Will'i Kemp in stallacione d'ni Archiepiscopi Ebor. per 7 dies versus Ebor. et ibidem, 40s.; in 2 ferretz empt. pro cuniculis capiendis, 3s. 4d.; in 1 pari de bouchez empt. pro officio terrarii, 20d. (etc.).

DIV2.P: Exp. Sol. pro expens. Terrarii tenentis Mariscalciam See the Rolls entitled "Marescalcia Prioris," page 326. apud Stayndrop et Fery et alibi, 9s. 4d.; in vino empto et expen. in turno Halm. tento circa festum Nat. Sci. Joh. Bapt. per d'nm Thomam Lith Bursarium, 5s.; in exp. factis in eadem turno, 10s. 9d.; in exp. factis apud Mugleswyk ad curiam et consignacionem animalium, 3s. 2d. (etc.).

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1434-5.
DIV2.P: Rec. 30li. 18s. 7d. ob.

Exp. Joh'i Stele, Cantori, 14s. 4d. (etc.). Will'o Bogett pro factura senapii ac custodia seminis ex con∣vencione, 20s. Et in semine empto, videlicet 2 quart. 3 bus., prec. bus. 20d., 31s. 8d. Et in 40 petr. plumbi emp. pro pandoxatorio, 13s. 4d. (etc.).

Et de nil rec. de bras. ville de Willyngton, tamen r. sol., 2s. Et de 26s. 8d. rec. pro Averpenys (16s.), Cornage (8s.), Elsilver (12d.), et Metred (20d.) ville de Overheworth (etc.) Et de 24s. rec. de tenentibus de Coupon et Billingham pro Cartsilver (etc.).

Et sol. semine senapii empt. hoc anno in dioec. Dunelm. et Cleveland, 26s. 2d. Et sol. Willelmo Clif pro custodia ac factura ejusdem per annum ex convencione, 20s. Et sol. in medicinis equorum (12d.) una cum pastura unius equi in parco de Aukland, 4s. 4d. Et sol. pro lignis et factura unius le bay in stabilo Terrarii, 6s.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1507-8.
DIV2.P:
Rec. 51 entries, including Cornage and Elsilver from Wallsend, Bras. ejusdem ville (and of other villages), Averpenes, Cornage, Elsilver and Metred of Overheworth
and of other places. 20s. de manerio de Bellacis; 24s. pro 6 acris prati vocati pratum Terrarii in Edmondens'; 12s. pro factura et caruc' feni dicti prati pertinent. de Billing∣ham; 24s. de tenent. de tenentibus de Coupon et Billing∣ham pro Cartsilver; 4s. 6d. pro Cornagio et Metred de Shelome in Estmeryngton; 10s. de residuo brasii ibidem de le hostre house ibidem; (etc.).

Expense. In expens. trium Halmot., 38s. 4d.; in speciebus emptis in eisdem, 5s. 9d.; office expenses, 7s. 2d.; payment to the Sacrist imposed by the lord Prior A.D. 1477, 100s.; tunic, cowl, and pair of boots for accountant, 24s.; Granatorio Dunelm. ex curialitate consueta erga Natale Domini, 3s. 4d.; gifts at Christmas, and to the cooks at Easter, 12s. 10d.; et sol. Edwardo Swalwell, valecto Terrarii, pro stipendio suo, una cum 6s. 8d. pro toga estivali, 26s. 8d.; pro collectione pecunie Terrarii, 4s.; gromo ejusdem, 13s. 4d.; in oblacionibus computantis quia nil recepit de Feretrario, 16s.; in liberatura empt. pro quinque pueris ecclesie erga Natale D'ni, 20s.; pro semine senappii emp. in dioc. Dunelm. et Cleweland, 27s. 8d.; pro custodia ac factura ejusdem, 20s.; custodi de Feryclyff pro stipendio suo, 6s. 8d.; 6 plaustr. feni empt., 24s.; pro (blank) quart. avenarum, una cum (blank) quart. pisarum ac fabarum, 37s. 6d.; in empcione et reparacione ornamentorum equorum, 5s. 6½d.; pro medecinis equorum, cum pastu unius equi in parco de Brauncepath, 3s. 10d.; magistro Empson Regis Consiliario, ex precepto domini Prioris, 40s.; in elemosina et denariis datis diversis ex precepto d'ni Prioris, 14s. 6d.; in pergameno, papiro, una cum scriptura hujus compoti, 16d.
Summa, 22li. 16s. od. ob.
There are three copies of the above roll, endorsed Pars d'ni Prioris, Pars Granatoris, and Pars officii.

DIV2.HEAD: Compotus Johannis de Nesebyt, Instaurarii Prioratus Dunelm. a festo Pentecostes Anno D'ni Millesimo cccoxxxviijo, usque idem festum Anno D'ni Millesimo cccoxxxixo, per unum annum integrum.
DIV2.P: Rec. den. Arr. Idem reddit compotum de 4li. 12s. 6d. ob. de arr. precedentis compoti sui.

Et de 5s. rec. de precio unius tauri de instauro de Mukling' I.e., Muklyngwic, now Muggleswick. venditi. [A large number of similar entries relating to sales of cattle, sheep, lambs, hides, lacticinium, and agistment in le Holme. Instauri of Wascropheued, Beurep', Fery, Houghall, Pittingdon, Wyuestowe, Holme, Barton Cotes, Beulu, Belassys, Ketton, are mentioned. Scores of sheep that had died in murrain are sold to dan W. de Hexham Cellarer. E.g., Et de xxvs. rec. de precio carnium vxx ovium matricium de instauro de Pytingdon, mortuorum in morina, vend. d'no W. de Hexham Celerario, quolibet 3d. Et de xli. xiiijs. rec. de Dvxxxix pell. lanut. et Diiijxxxvij pellett. de morina . . . venditis in grosso. Hides of animals in like case are sold in abundance].
Summa, 49li. 3s. 1d.

Expense. Structura domorum. [Timber at Thurstans∣ton for bercaria in Spennymore, 26s. 8d.; new bercaria at Ketton, 33s. 4d.; drink for carpenters and helpers on the day the timber was got, 7d.; ditching round garden of bercaria, 6s. 8d.; sawing boards for doors of bercaria, 16d.; repairing bercaria at Pytingdon, 3s. 11d.; making West∣flodyates at Mukling', 4s. 6d.; repairing walls of bercaria at the Holme, 9d.; covering it in, 3s. 7d. ob.; a man serving, 21d. ob. qa.; 20 spikings, 1d.; carpenter making bridges at the Holme, 2s.; constructing new bercaria at Spennymore, 26s. 8d.; more for large timber at Thurstanton for the same, 58s. 6d.].
Summa, 7li. 3s. 9d. qa.

Custus ovium. Et in iiijxx hoggastris masculis emptis ad augmentandum instaurum de Ketton, 4li. Et in 1 hurtardo emp. pro le Holme, 18d. Et in terra et alba pinguedine emp. pro ovibus ungendis infra tempus compoti, 53s. 9d. Et in 64 lagenis lactis emp. pro agnis del Holme, 5s. 4d. Et in 30 lagenis lactis emp. pro agnis de Wyuestowe, 2s. 6d. Et in 13 lagenis lactis emp. pro agn. de Pytingdon, 14d. Et mulieri colligenti dictum lac per diversa loca, 14d. ob. Et in locione et tonsione ovium per prioratum hoc anno, 32s. 8d. Et in expensis Terrarii, Bursarii, et Instaurarii, et secum existencium, circueundo per prioratum circa locionem et tonsuram ovium hoc anno, 46s. 4d.
Summa, 11li. 4s. 5d. ob.

Varie expense. In dono Terrarii forestariis de Wascropheued, 6s. 4d.; in 6xx12 perticatis foss. factis inter blad. et prata apud Horsleyhop', 11s.; repar. foss. apud Wascropheued, 3s. 4d.; repar. haye apud Garps∣chele, 4d.; 13 acr. prati falcand. apud Holme, per acr. 5d., 5s. 5d.; in herba spargenda, 3d.; in feno faciendo, 21d.; in 2 carrectatis cirporum falcandis pro tasso feni cooperiendo, 5d.; in tribus carrect. cirp. falc. pro cooper∣tura bercarie de Beulu, 9d.; in 46 perticatis del kerr jactand. apud Holme, per perticat. 3d.; 11s. 6d.; in servicio ij hominum facientium muros del Holme per 5 dies, et 1 hominis per 1 diem, cuique per diem 3d., 2s. 9d.; duobus portantibus aquam ad idem per v dies et 1 per diem, cuique per diem 1d. ob., 16d. ob.; et in tribus portis empt., 18d.; 9 mulieribus siccantibus et tassantibus fenum del Holme per 2 dies, cuique per diem 2d.; 18d.; cuidam homini facienti murum circa parcum feni per 3 dies, 9d.; in uno cacabo emp. pro dayeria de Counesden, 3s. 8d.; et
in ernyng' emp. pro eadem dayeria, 15d.; in 2 skeles emp. pro eadem, 5d.; in 1 kirne emp. pro eadem, 5d.; in 2 tubbes et 2 chesfattes emp. pro eadem, 12d.; in tela pro cheseclutes emp. pro eodem, 5d.; ernyng pro Garpschele, 12d.; tela, 5d.; chesefat, 2d.; 1 mele, 2d.; in emendacione cacabi, 3d.; bercario de Pytingdon pro sale, 3s. 6d.; pro bobus et stircis fugandis de Beurep' usque Wardley et Wascropheued per vices, 8d.
Summa, 63s. 3d. ob.
Stipendia famulorum de termino Sancti Martini Anno, etc., '38.

Et tribus bercar. de Ketton, 12s.; 5 berc. del Holme, 20s.; berc. de Fery, 4s.; Houghall, 4s.; Pytingdon, 4s.; Wyuestowe, 4s.; tribus berc. de Mukling', 12s.; Vaccario de Mukling, 5s.; Daye de Mukling', 2s.; Vaccario de Counesden, 3s.; Daye ibidem, 2s.; et duobus pastoribus de Wascropheued, 6s.
Stipendia famulorum predictorum de termino Pent., anno, etc., 39o.
Et duobus berc. de Ketton, 6s.; quinque berc. de Holme, Barton, Cotes, Belassys, et Beulu, 15s.; Berc. de Fery, 3s.; Pytingdon, 3s.; Houghall, 3s.
(Here the end of the roll has been cut off).

DIV2.HEAD: Visus instauri Prioratus Dunelm. ad signacionem et tonsionem, Anno D'ni Millesimo cccoxljo.
DIV2.P: Holm. Oves Matrices. Johannes Page, bercarius de Holm, respondet de ixclij ovibus matricibus de rem. Et de lxxvj rec. de bercario de Ketton. Summa, Mlviij. De quibus, In vend. per instaurar. iiijxx, unde xl, quelibet ad viijd., et xl, quelibet ad vd., de quibus Instaurar. respondet. Et in morina, lj. Carn. iij vend. pro iijd. Carn. xlviij nullius valoris. Et lib. Stephano bercar. Summa expend., cxvj. Et sic ducte ad tonsionem, viijcvxxxij, habentes tot vellera, cum vell. bercar. Postea rec. de Johanne bercario de Belasis ciiijxxx. Et sic summa rem. cum eodem, Mliiijxxij.
Pell. et Pellett'. Idem r. de xxv pell. lan. et xxvj pellett' de tot ovibus matricibus mort. in morina, ut supra, et lib. Instaurario.

Agni. Idem r. de vijcxx agnis utriusque sexus de exitu hujus anni. De quibus, in morina, iiijxx; carn. nullius valoris; pelles lib. Burs. Et lib. Joh'i bercario de
Belasis, ccxx femelle; et Joh'i bercar. de Beulu, ccxx masculi. Et Roberto berc. de Ketton, ciiijxxiij, quorum vxxiij mas. Item lib. eidem, xx agni utriusque sexus non signati. Et in dono diversis bercariis et aliis, xxij. Summa expens., Dccv. Et rem. xv agni in custodia ejusdem.

Belasis. Hogastr. xij pell. lan. xviij pellet. Joh'es Bercar. de Belasis respondet de cvxx iiij hoggastr. de rem. agnorum anni preteriti. Et de xvj rec. de bercar. de Ketton; Summa, cc. De quibus, in morina, xxx, carn. nullius valoris; pell. lib. Instaurario. Et lib. Joh'i Page bercario de Holm ut supra, ciiijxxx. Postea recepit de Joh'e Page bercario del Holm ccxx agnos femell.

[Similar accounts for Beulu, Barton, Cotes (lib. d'no R. de Kell celerario iiijxx multones), Ketton, Pytingdon; there seem to be always a number of sheep dying in morina; the flesh of some is sold, the rest is nullius valoris].
Mukling'. Equorum. Will's Couhird, stodardus, re∣spond. de xvj jumentis de rem. Summa patet. De quibus, in morina j. Corium nullius valoris. Summa, j. Et rem. xv.

Idem r. de j stalone rec. de empcione; Summa, j. Et rem. Idem r. de ij pullanis masculis, nunc duorum annorum, de annali rem. Et rem. Idem r. de iij pultris nunc duorum annorum, de rem. annali j. Et rem. Idem r. de j pull. et j pultra nunc annal. de exitu anni preteriti. Et rem.
Taur. Will's Couhird, vaccarius, respond. de iij taur. de rem. Et rem.
Idem r. (de vaccis, stircis, vitulis).
Wascroppheued. Will's Cuttes respond. (de stircis ij annorum, tauris, stottis, stircis iij annorum).
Beaurep'. Ad. Couhird resp. (de jumentis, pullanis, pultris, staggis, tauris, vaccis, stottis, stircis annal., vitulis).
Adhuc Mukling'. Ad. Bercar. resp. (de multonibus, pellibus, et pellet'). In perdicione per metum Scottorum, j (e multonibus).
Fery. Rad's Bercar. respond. (de multonibus).
Wyuestowe. Joh'es Willy, bercar., resp. (de ovibus matricibus, pell. et pellets, hogastris, agnis).

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. Michaelis, Bercarii apud Hughall, 1380-81.
DIV2.P: Multon. In primis idem resp. de cccclvj de rem comp. precedentis.

De quibus, in liberacione facta bercario de Meryngton, iiijxxiiij. Et in morina in estate, xiiij carn. nullius valoris; pell. vendr pro xxjd.; et in morina in yheme, liij, carn. nullius valoris, pellis venditur quilibet pro iijd., xiijs. iijd. Et in devoracione per canes in quadragesima vij, carnes nullius valoris, pell. cuilibet venr pro quolibet iijd., xxjd. Et in furacione per homines de Lancasterschir ijd. Et in liberacione facta d'no Thome Legat, Celerario, ij, prec. cap. xvjd. Et in liberac. facta servienti de Houghhall pro expens. Autumpn. j, prec. xiiijd. Et in morina cito ante tonsionem, j, carn. nullius valoris, pell. vend. pro iijd.
Summa viijxxiiij. Et rem. cccxij, quos duxit ad tonsionem. Postea recepit de Joh'e, bercario de Meryngton iiijxx. Et sic est summa rem. cum eodem, ccciiijxxxij.

Rec. In primis idem r. de iiijs. vjd. pend. super Joh'em de Chivyngton pro ij multonibus devoratis per canes. Et de xvjs. ixd. rec. de pellibus. Et de xiiijd. rec. de j multone liberato servient. de Houghall. Et de iijd. rec. de pell. j multonis mortui in morina.
Summa, xxijs. ixd.
De quibus comp. in stipendio suo pro toto anno pre∣terito, xijs. Et in superplus comp. precedentis, ijs.
Summa, xiiijs. Et sic deb. viijs. ixd., unde pendet super Joh'em de Chivyngton iiijs. vjd.
On back of same roll are similar accounts, viz.:
Joh'is de Heswell, bercarii apud Brontschell.
Joh'is Gris, berc. apud Pollowhill.
Joh'is Shepherd, berc. apud Meryngton.

DIV2.HEAD: Compotus Instaur. d'ni Prioris Dunelm., 1387-8. Including the accounts that follow.
DIV2.P: Comp. Rob. Stevenson, Vaccarii apud Cappeschele.
(Taur., Vacc., Vituli annal., Vituli de exitu).

Recept. 19s. 6d. de lacticinio 13 vaccar. ad plenam firmam, videlicet pro vacc. xviij. Et de 5s. 3d. rec. de lacticinio 7 vaccarum ad medietatem firme. Et nil de 21 quia steriles. Et de vjd. rec. de uno corio superius vendito.
Summa, 25s. 3d.
De quibus compotat in stipendio suo usque festum Invencionis Sce. Crucis, 5s. In clausura hayarum, 2s. Item in lucracione xiij plaustr. et di. feni, plaustr., 3d.; summa, 3s. 10d. ob.
Summa, 10s. 10d. ob.
Et sic debet 13s. 4d. ob., de qua summa solut. Joh'i Brak 3s. 4d., et solvit 11s. ob. super comp. et quietus (est).

DIV2.HEAD: Other accounts follow, similar in character, viz.:—
DIV2.P: Comp. Thome Johnson, Vaccarii apud Estirblacden in Wardall.
Comp. Walteri Colson, Vacc. apud Mugleswyk.
Comp. Walteri Todd, Stirkettar' apud Wharnowe.
Comp. Joh'is Collanwode, Stirkettar' apud Burnhop∣schele in Wardale.
Comp. Joh. Brak, Vaccarii apud Wascropheued.
Comp. Joh. Gryce, Bercarii apud Pollowhill.
Comp. Ade de Fourneys, Berc. apud le Westgate.
Comp. Petri Scathelok, Bovettar' apud Wascropheuid.
Comp. Ric'i White, Vacc. apud Nethirdeyhous.
Comp. Rob'i Cragg, Vacc. ap. le Overdeyhous.
Comp. Joh. Mayson, Bercar. apud Byrkhous.
Comp. Thome Bercar. del Holm.
Recept. (inter alia). Et de 55s. 4d. rec. de 4xx3 petr. casii venditi, prec. petr. 8d. Et nil de 10 petr. et di. butiri, quia mixtum fuit cum bitumine pro ovibus et hoggettis unguent.

Exp. (inter alia). In solucione facta 9 mulieribus lactantibus over per 8 septimanas, quilibet (sic) capit per septimanam 4d., 24s. [Haymaking]. In factura j tasse ibidem, 12d. In solucione facta 1 famulo auxilianti tempore agnorum per unum mensem, cap. per septimanam 14d., 4s. 8d. Item 2 bus. salis empt. pro casio et butiro, 10d.; in 3 skelys empt. pro lacte, 9d.; una petra (casei) pro cariacione casii ultra Tesam tempore fugacionis causa Scotorum, quia superius oneratur.

P.HI: The above roll consists of five skins, and is nearly twelve feet long.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. Instaur. d'ni Prioris Dunelm., 1399-1400.
DIV2.P: Comp. Rob. Cragg, Vaccarii apud Overdeyhous.
Vacce. (j in morina ad fest. Nat. S. J. B., j carn. nullius valoris quia putrida . . correum venditur pro viijd.).
Rec. (viijd. de j corio vacc. mort. in morina. Nil de vj (vaccis) quia vituli eas lactaverunt).
Comp. Joh'is Raven, Vaccarii apud Nethirdeihous.
Vituli annales. xxj. (De quibus in morina j; carn. nec cor. nullius valoris).
Comp. Ric'i Robynson, Vacc. apud Whythall.

P.HI: Tauri; Vacce; Vituli ann.; Vituli de exitu; Rec.; Boves.

DIV2.P: Comp. Walteri Todd, Vaccarii apud Wascropheued.
Comp. Will. del Shele, Stirkett' apud Birkehouse.
Stirkett. (Here, as always, some mention of murrain).
Comp. Roberti Jonson, Stottar' apud Wascrophed.
Comp. Joh'is Mayson, Bercarii apud Birkhous.
Multones, (in devoracione per wlpes et in morina xvj multon.; carn. de iij venduntur pro viij(d.) carn. aliorum nullius valoris; pelles remanent versus eum).
Rec. Against these he has paid, uni famulo fuganti gregem ad tonsionem, vjd.
Comp. Thome Bercarii de Biewrepair.
Multon. (in capcione per ministros Regis iiij).

Rec. xvjd. pro carn. vend. De quibus petit allocari in stipendio suo pro toto anno xiijs. iiijd. In sagimine empt. xiiijd. Summa, xiiijs. vjd. Et sic debentur computanti xiijs. ijd. There are similar allowances on or in excess of receipts in each case. Stipends up to Inv. of Holy Cross are 5s., 7s., 13s. 4d., and there is often mention of sagimen (for sheep-salve).
Comp. Joh'is Wethirhard, Hoggettarii apud Hoghall.
Agni. (In comestione per famulos d'ni n'ri Regis, v.).
Comp. Joh'is Hobson, Bercar. apud Hoghall.
Comp. Will'i Sawer, Stirkettar' apud Rylly, 1398-9.
Comp. predicti Willelmi, 1399-1400.
Comp. Joh'is, Bercarii del Holm.
Comp. Will'i Morland, Hogg' apud le Holm.
Comp. Ric'i Brome, Bercarii de Wyuestow.
Comp. Joh'is Gris, Bercarii apud Brontschell.
This roll is endorsed, Comp. Instaurator. de diversis Maneriis.

On the back of this roll are also lists of names with what seem to be wages or alms in small sums of money or in milk and other provisions; they are arranged under places, thus:—Shyncliff, 45 names; Baronia, 90; Elvett, 84; Fynkall, 11; Burne, 5; Aldurham, 9; Brome et Rille, 14; Stottesȝate, 3; Hoghall, 5; Aldyngrigge, 2.
These lists are in different writing and seem to have no connection with the accounts of stock.

DIV2.HEAD: Compotus Joh'is Schepard, Bercarii apud le Holme, 1416-17.
DIV2.P: Et nil de rem. compoti precedentis.
Multon. Et de vxxxvij multonibus ex admiccione hoggestr', ut patet inferius. Et omnes remanent.

Hurtard'. In primis idem r. de xiiij hurtard' de Rem. compoti precedentis. Et de ij de admiccione hoggastr' rec. de Will'o Dycon, custode hoggastrorum apud le hoggecot'. De quibus in morina ij circa festum Inv. Sce. Crucis ante tonsionem; carn. nullius valoris, quia putred., per sacramentum compotantis; pell. lib. super comp. Summa alloc., ij. Et Rem. xiiij hurtard'.
Oves matrices. Et de Dcciiijxxxj ov. matric. de Rem. compoti precedentis ultimi anni.
Et de ccxxx ex admiccione jercarum ut patet inferius de rem. compoti precedentis.
Et de ccxxxviij ex admiccione jercarum recept. de Will'o Dycon ut patet per tall. contra eundem.
Summa, Mlccxxxix.

[Accounted for by sales, murrain, and remainder con∣sisting of Dccccvxxxvij. In morina, in lez pokkes ante tonsionem, ciiijxxxvij. Hides accounted for. Flesh of no value. Item in expensis diversarum carucarum arrancium terram d'ni apud Neuton et Byllyngham ante tonsionem, vj pell. lib. super compotum These hides seem to have been used for making plough-traces and other harness for ploughs.].
Jerce. Et de ccxxx jercis de rem. comp. prec. Et omnes adjunguntur ad oves matrices ut supra. Et nichil rem.
Hoggestri. Et de vxxxix hoggestris de rem. comp. prec. Et de cxxxiij de adjunccione agnorum ut patet in∣ferius.
Summa, ccxxxij.
[Accounted for by being admitted to be multones, ut supra, and by murrain; so remain iiijxx].
Agni. Et de cxxxiij agnis mas. de rem. co. pr. Et de Diiijxxviij agn. de toto exitu hujus anni.
Summa, Dccj.

[Accounted for by admission to be hoggastri, ut supra, and morina tempore agnellacionis. Among expenses are, in hides disposed of, Sco. Antonio, j, Probably for some image of St. Anthony, who distributed his sheep∣skin garments among his friends just before his death.—Vita S. Ant., § 91. pro spanyng lambes, ij, etc. to different persons. Et in liberacione facta Will'o Dycon custodi apud le hoggecote, cccxl, unde ccxx fem. et cxx mas. Et in vendicione ut patet inferius cxx prec. capit. ijd., xxiijs. iiijd. Summa que supra. Et nil rem.].
Arr. Et de lijs. ijd. de Arr. ult. comp. prec.
Rec. [From sales of sheep, lambs, hides, milk and dairy produce of 300 ewes, and 13s. 4d. from the Terrar in cash. Total, 7li. 6s. 9d. ob.].

Alloc. [Stipend, 26s. 8d.; pro j famulo vocato Trippyngknase, We should expect Trippyngknafe, errand-boy, but the MS. certainly has Trippyngknase. 4s.; pro carbon. empt., 3s.; haymak∣ing; cash to Terrar; total, 56s. 7d. ob.].

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. Will'i Dycon, bercarii apud le Hoggecote, 1416-17.
DIV2.P: [Hoggasters from admission of jerce; lambs remain∣ing and received; some admitted as jerce, and some lost by murrain].

Rec. [From sales of sheep, lambs, and hides; 7s. 6d. pro operibus de Berneskarr. Total, 4li. 7s. 1d. ob. Spent in haymaking, thatching; his own stipend, 16s.; and delivered to Terrar, 6s. 8d. Thus he owes 36s. 5d. ob.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem a festo Nat. S. J. B. 1417, usque f. S. Mart. in hyeme.
DIV2.P: In primis idem r. de cccxl agnis de rem. ult. comp. anni prox. prec., unde cxx mas. et ccxx fe.

De quibus in morina lxij, in quodam morbo voc. le redeyll, per sacramentum compotantis, unde de carn. nichil, quia putredi, pell. xx venduntur pro xd., de pellett' nichil, quia nullius valoris per sacr. comp. Et lib. Ric'o Malpas, cciijxxxviij. Et nil rem.
In primis idem resp. de xxxvjs. vd. ob. de arr. ult. comp. anni prox. preced. Et de xd. rec. de xx pell. agn. superius sic venditis.

Summa, xxxvijs. iijd. ob. De quibus lib. Hos∣tillario, xxxjs. Et eidem in prec. vij bus. senapii prec., vs. iiijd. Et lib. Joh'i Shepard ex mandato Terrarii, iijs. iiijd. Item alloc. eidem pro stipendio suo per tempus compoti, viijs.
Summa lib. et alloc., xlvijs. viijd.
Et hec in superplusagio, xs. iiijd. ob.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. Rob'ti Cawdcloffe(?) servientis d'ni Thome (Lawson) Bursarii Dunelm. apud Spennyngmour, 1433-4.
DIV2.P: Contains nothing of special interest.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. Instauratoris Name gone. apud le Holmes, 1447.
DIV2.P:
Expens. Necessar. Et sol. pro emendacione murorum luteorum circa domum barcarie et clausure ibidem, 6s. 8d. Et pro purgacione cujusdam fossati ibidem, 5s. Et sol. pro emendacione et refeccione fossarum ad conservand.
aquam recentem ibidem, 2s. Et sol. pro tectura barcarie ibidem, 5s. Et sol. pro clavibus emptis de Thoma Smyth ad emendanda hostia ibidem, 8d. Et sol. pro lucracione 10 carect. subbosci in parco de Beaulewe cum cariagio, et cum factura hayorum circa prata infra le Holme, 4s.
Summa, 24s. 4d.

HEAD.NOTE: This would seem to be really the recto of the roll, but it looks like a verso.
HEAD.HI: Willelmi de Stauro dicti Prioris apud le Holme per tempus infrascriptum.

DIV3.P: Hurterdi. In primis idem resp. de x hurterd. rec. de rem. ult. comp. Et rem. x.
Multon'. Et de ccmaiiijxxxiij multon. rec. de rem. ult. comp. Et de cmaxl rec. de adjunccione hoggastr.
Summa, ccccmaxiij.
De quibus liberantur pro ludis d'ni Prioris, xxiiij. Et in expensis curie, iiij.
Summa mise, xxviij. Et rem., cccmavxxv.
Oves Matr. Et de Dcmaxv ovibus matr. rec. de rem. ult. comp. Et de cmalvj rec. de adjunccione jercarum.
Summa, Dccmalxxj.
De quibus venduntur ut infra, iiijxxj. Et mort. in morina, xj.
Summa mise, iiijxxxij. Et rem., Dciiijxxxix.
Et de ccmaiiijxxxvj hoggastris et jercis rec. de rem. ult. comp. Et de cmal rec. de adjunccione agnorum.
Summa, ccccmaxxvj.
De quibus junguntur supra cum multonibus, cmaxl. Et cum ovibus matricibus, cmalvj. Et mort. in morina, iiijxxj.
Summa mise, ccclvij. Et rem., iiijxxxix.
Et de cmal agn. rec. de rem. ult. comp. Et de Dmalxvj rec. de exit. hujus anni.
Summa, Dcmavxxxvj.

De quibus junguntur supra cum hoggastris et jercis, cmal. Et vend. ut infra, cmaiiijxxxj. Et liberantur pro ludis d'ni Prioris, xxx. Et expenduntur in tonsione ovium, una cum expens. curie et cum ij spanynglamez et j Antonlam, xviij. Et mort. in morina, xxiij.
Summa mise, cccmavxxxij. Et rem. cccmaxxiiijor. Should be 304.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. Rad'i Holtby Instauratoris Prioris Dunelm. apud le Holme, 1459-60.
DIV2.P: Arr. Nulla.

Stipendia. Idem computat in stipendio dicti compu∣tantis causa officii sui predicti ad 20s. per annum, per tempus compoti, 20s. Et solut. Rob'to Jakson pastori et custodi multonum et ovium matricum ad 26s. 8d. per annum, 26s. 8d. Et solut. Henrico Chatour, Custodi hoggastr. et jercarum per tempus compoti, 13s. 4d.
Summa, 60s.

Cust. feni. Et in solucione facta pro falcacione xxiiij acr. prati in le Bernesker, acr. ad 6d., unde per manus tenencium ville de Billyngham, 7s. 6d. Et sic dictus computans habebit alloc. nisi de 4s. 6d., 4s. 6d. Et sol. pro factura herbagii provenientis de dictis xxiiij acr. prati in siccum fenum, 8s. Et sol. pro falcacione de le Holmclose hoc anno cum 2s. 6d.; solut. pro falcacione de le Lamme∣dowe cont. 5 acr. prati, una cum 20d.; solut. pro factura tocius herbagii provenientis de dictis 5 acr., 12s. 2d.
Summa, 24s. 8d.

Cust. reparac. Et sol. pro emendacione unius muri juxta le yowecote (6d.), et alterius parcell. muri ibidem (6d.), ac unius parcell. muri apud le lamcote (6d.), 19d. Et sol. pro tectura apud de lambecote, 12d.
Liberacio denariorum. Et sol. d'no Thome Ayre, supervisori dicti Stauri, 20s.
Summa, 20s.

Summa totalis alloc. et liberac., 107s. 3d. Et sic debet, 4li. 3s. 7d.; unde lib. dicto d'no Tho. Ayre in precio pell. et pellett., 7s. Et inde allocatur dicto computanti pro scriptura hujus compoti, prout in compoto precedente, 2s. 4d. Et sic reman. clare, 74s. 3d., quos solvit super compotum.
Verso. An account of stock similar to that of 1447.

DIV2.P: Empcio stauri. 70 hoggez, 73s.; 6 hoggez, 6s. 6d.; 79s. 6d.

Expens. Et sol. pro falcacione et levacione feni per tempus compoti, 22s. 2d. Et sol. Roberto Broune cum 1 famulo operant. in tenura barcar' ibidem per 6 dies ad 7d., 3s. 6d. Et sol. Joh'i Cant et Rob'to Cornforth pro 17 diebus et di. inter se in emendacione barcar' ibidem ad 10d., 11s. 8d. Et eisdem pro opere carpentr. unius domus de
novo edificate in grosso, 7s.; et sol. pro cariacione meremii et wattils a diversis locis, 4s. 5d. Et sol. Joh'i Goldyng et Will'mo Richestre pro factura murorum dicte domus, 8s.; et sol. Rob'to Broune pro tectura dicte domus, 4s.; et sol. pro stramine empto, 10d.; et sol. pro le medowthak empt. cum cariagio, 6s. 8d.; et in 22 asser' cum brodnale empt., 2s.; et in prostracione del stowrys in parco de Acley, 7d.; et sol. tenentibus de Billingham pro mundacione de les flettez circa le Holme, 5s. 10d. Et sol. pro custodia et conservacione agnorum apud Mogleswik, 4s. 8d.; et in pergameno, papiro, et scribenti hunc compotum, 12d.
Summa, 4li. 2s. 4d.
Summa omn. exp. et alloc., 8li. 22d.
Et sic rem. super computantem, 16li. 15s. 2d.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. ejusdem, 1481-2.
DIV2.P: Cust. feni cum exp. necessariis. Factura murorum circa le Stakgarth; pro prostracione del rongez in Acleywod, (etc.).

DIV1.HEAD: ROTULUS SUPERVISORIS EQUICII. The only one that has been found.

DIV2.HEAD: Compotus fratris Henrici Helay, Supervisoris Equicii Venerabilis Patris Joh'is d'ni Prioris . . . a festo Sci. Petri quod dicitur Advincula Anno D'ni Mill'mo ccccmo vicesimo usque idem festum . . . . usque festum Inven∣cionis Sce. Crucis extunc prox. sequens.
DIV2.P: Arreragia. Nulla, quia compotat hic primo.

Agistamenta equorum. Set idem resp. de 8li. 12s. 8d. rec. de agistamento 48 equorum infra parcum de Beaure∣pair a festo Invencionis Sce. Crucis hoc anno ad festum Michaelis tunc prox. sequens agistatorum cap. pro singulo equo, 3s. 4d.
Summa, 8li. 16s. 8d.

Vend. equor., jument., et pull. Et de 30s. rec. de 3 jumentis, 2 pultris masculis 2or annor., 1 pull. fe. unius anni, et 6 pull. fe. de exitu, sic venditis in grosso Thome del Halle, quia debiles et inutiles ad staurum. Et de 4li. 16s. 8d. rec. de 2 equis de stauro d'ni sic venditis per Robertum Cok ad nundinas de Rypon hoc anno.
Summa, 6li. 6s. 8d.
Recepcio forinc. Et de 76s. 8d. rec. de d'no Priore in pecunia munerata.
Summa patet.

Empcio equorum. De quibus idem compotat in 1 equo empto de Joh'e Cotour, prec. 40s. Et in 1 jumento cum pullo empt. de Rob'to Cok, prec. 46s. 8d. Et in 1 jumento empt. de Ric'o Arnald, prec. 40s. Et in 5 jumentis empt. de Thoma Waynhop, prec. 76s. 8d.
Summa, 10li. 3s. 4d.

Allocaciones. Et allocantur eidem compotanti 3s. 4d. per dominum condonat. Will'o Chaunceller pro agista∣mento 1 equi. Et eidem condonat Suffraganeo d'ni E'pi
pro agistamento 1 equi. Et eidem 3s. 4d. per d'nm condonat. Botuland Darci pro agistamento. Et eidem 10s. per d'nm condonat. Ric'o Cowherd pro agistamento trium equorum, unde idem compotans superius oneratur.
Summa, 20s.

Liberaciones denariorum. Et lib. Thome Tesedale, Stodardo d'ni, pro custodia equicii ejusdem a festo Sci. Petri quod dicitur Advincula infra hunc compotum, usque idem festum prox. post clausum hujus compoti, viz. anno Domini, etc. 22o, ex convencione cum eo facta, 30s. Et lib. d'no per manus Rob'ti Cok, 4li. 16s. 8d.
Summa, 6li. 6s. 8d.
Summa omn. expens. soluc. et liberat., 17li. 10s.
Et sic deb., 30s.

HEAD.HI: Exitus Equicii d'ni Anno quo infro.
HEAD.NOTE: I.e., on the recto of the roll (see above).

DIV3.P: . . non r. de aliquo stalone rec. de stauro d'ni ex adjunccione nec ex empcione hoc anno.
Summa nichil. Et Rem. nichil.

Set idem r. de 3 equis de stauro d'ni, rec. de rem. super ultimum compotum fratris Will'i Barry, ultimi supervisoris ejusdem Equicii ante ipsum compotantem. Et de 1 ex empcione ut infra. De quibus lib. palefridarius d'ni ad usum ejusdem, 1. Et in vendicione ut infra, 2. Et lib. Joh'i Syburn carrectario d'ni, 1.
Summa, 4. Et rem. null.
Et de 12 jumentis rec. de stauro d'ni de rem. compoti predicti Willelmi Barry. Et de 7 jumentis ex empcione ut infra, unde 5 ambulantes.
Summa, 19.
De quibus venduntur ut infra, 3. Summa, 3. Et rem. 16 jumenta, unde quinque ambulantes.
Et de 4 pultr. mas. 3 annorum, unde 2 gray et 2 nigri, de rem. predicti Will'i.
Summa, 4. Et omnes remanent.
Et de 2 pultr. mas. 2or annorum, rec. de rem. predicti Willelmi. Et de 1 mas. ex adjunccione annalium, ut patet inferius.
Summa, 3.
De quibus venduntur ut infra, 2. Et remanet 1 mas.
Et de 4 pullanis fem. 2or annorum rec. de rem. predicti Will'i. Et omnes remanent.
Et de 11 pull. annalibus rec. de rem. predicti Will'i ex adjunccione tot pull. de exitu ut patet inferius. Et de 2 pull. fem. ex empcione ut infra, unde 6 mas. et 7 fem.
De quibus vend. ut infra 1 fem. Et in adjunccione ad pultr. mas. ut supra 1 mas. Et rem. 11, unde 6 mas. et 5 fem.

Et de 11 pull. provenientibus de exitu predictorum jumentorum rec. de rem. predicti Will'i. Et de 6 ex empcione ut infra, unde 8 mas. et 9 fe. De quibus junguntur annalibus ut supra 11, unde 6 mas., 5 fe. Et in vendicione ut infra, 7.
Summa, 17. Et remanent nulli.

HEADNOTE.P: The rolls that appear under this head have no connec∣tion with "marescalcia" in its usual sense as denoting farriery, but relate to an inspection of weights, measures, etc., which formed a part of the business of the various manor courts held by the authority of the Prior, and seems to have been conducted by the Terrar, Bursar, or others (see pp. 305, 329, 336). These Marescalcia Rolls are so much contracted, and the contractions are often so am∣biguous or obscure, that it has been thought best to print them as nearly as possible as they stand, only expanding some contractions in italic type, and printing without any stops. A few sentences are here given with con∣jectural expansion and translation.

Willelmus Pouer, brasiator, buscellus; firmarius, molendinarius; buscellus non sigillatus, ideo forisfactus, ideo in misericordia. Non ostendit galonem, potellum, nec quartam, ideo in misericordia, nec mensuras molendini; ideo plegius de fine et misericordia Johannes Teddi.

William Pouer is a brewer, (he has) a bushel-measure. He is a farmer (i.e. has land on lease), and is a miller; his bushel is not sealed, and is therefore forfeited, therefore he is amerced (subject to a small fine). He does not exhibit a gallon, pottle, nor quart measure, therefore he is amerced, nor the measures of his mill; therefore John Teddi is surety for the fine and amerciament.

Johannes Teddi, buscellus, brasiator, pistor, hospitator Or some equivalent word.; non ostendit preter galonem bonum et sigillatum, potellum et terciam non sigillatos, buscellum, pec non sigillat., ideo forisfactos; plegius de fine et misericordia, et quia brasiat contra assisam, Willelmus Pouer.

John Teddi has a bushel, is a brewer, a baker, an innkeeper; he does not show anything but a gallon good and sealed, a pottle, and a third-part (of a gallon) not sealed, a bushel, a peck not sealed, therefore forfeited. William Pouer is surety for the fine and amerciament, and because he brews contrary to the assise (of ale).
Johannes de Redworth, brasiator; (habet) galonem bonum et sigillatum; non ostendit potellum nec quartam nec terciam, et brasiat contra assisam; plegius Willelmus fil. Henrici.

John de Redworth is a brewer; he has a gallon good and sealed; he does not show a pottle nor a quart nor a third-part (of a gallon) and he brews contrary to the assize: his surety is William Harrison.

Willelmus Colson, carnifex, ostendit pondus ad valen∣ciam 14li., non sigillatum, ideo forisfactum, et in misericordia, et quia vendit carnes contra assisam, ideo ponit se in gratiam domini; plegius de fine et misericordia Willelmus Pouer.

William Colson, butcher, shews a 14 lb. weight not sealed, therefore forfeited, and he is amerced, and, because he sells meat contrary to the assize, therefore he throws himself on the mercy of the lord (of the manor, i.e., the Prior). William Pouer is surety for the fine and amercia∣ment.
Ranulphus Webster (habet) ulnam nimis parvam, ideo forisfactam; plegius Johannes de Halghton de misericordia.
Ralph Webster has an ell that is too short, it is there∣fore forfeited; his surety for the amerciament is John Halghton.
Any reader who is sufficiently interested will probably be able to make out most of what follows; on doubtful points he must exercise his own judgment.

DIV2.HEAD: Marescalcia d'ni Pioris Dunelm tent' apud Acley die m'cur' p'x an' f'm S'ci Luce Ewangeliste (c. 1370-80).
DIV2.P: Will's Pouer bras bz Wherever in these rolls the form bz is printed, it stands for bȝ. firm' molend' bz nō si ideo for' i'o in mi'a nō ost ga po nc qa i'o in mi'a nc mens' molend' i'o pl' de fine & mi'a Joh's Teddi.
Joh's Teddi bz bras pist' ho nō ost p'ter ga (bo & si) Inserted above the line. po & ter nō si bz pc nō si i'o for' pleg' de fine & mi'a & quia bras' cona ass' Will's Pouer.
Joh's de Redworth bras' ga bo & si nō ost po nc qa nc ter & bras cona assam pl' Will's fil. Henr.
Will's (Colson) Inserted above the line. Carnifex ost po ad valenc xiiij li. nō si i'o for' & in mi'a & quia vendit carn' cona ass' i'o po se in gra' d'ni pl' de fine & mi'a Will's Pouer.
Ranulphus Webst' vln' nimis paru' i'o for' pl' Joh's de Halghton de mi'a.
Thomas Tailliour vln' nimis p'u' i'o for' & in mi'a.
Will's Vssher bras nl ost' i'o in mi'a pl' de fine & mi'a & quia bras cona ass' Will's Henr.
Thomas Bolton bz bras pist' bz bo & si nō ost ga nc qa sz For sȝ (sed). po no si i'o for' nc ost' pond' panis & bras cona ass' pl de fine & mi'a Gilb's Smith.
Nich's de Bewik bz pc bras ho' pist' nl ost sz po se in gra' d'ni tam de fine qam de mi'a Joh's Hexham.
Thomas P'kinson bras nl ost sz po se in gra' d'ni.
Will's Littest' pond nl ost sz po se in gra' d'ni pl' de mi'a Thomas Bolom.
Joh's Dalgan molendinar' ost' mens' nō i'o for' & po se in gra' d'ni pl' Will's Pouer.
Will's Randolf d'cus pist' nl ost' pan' nc pond' po se in gra' d'ni pl Joh's de Redworth.
Johan Yut Or Ynt? bras ga bo & si nō ost pl'ra mens' & bras' cona ass' po se in gra' d'ni pl' Will's Randolf.
Joh's Molend' Malst' bz nō venit & assign' die' vsz For vsȝ (usque). Burdon & post' venit & iur' q'd nō h'uit bz.
Will's Sout' fatetur q'd vendit corr. nō tann' pro tann' po se in gra' d'ni pl' Will's Currour.
Will's fil' Henr' carnifex nl ost' & vend carn' cona ass po se in gra' d'ni pl' Will's Colson.

DIV2.HEAD: Marescalcia d'ni Pioris Dunelm' tent' apud Bordon die Jou' in f'o S'ci Luce Ewangeliste.

The following roll is by far the longest in this series, though imperfect at the beginning. It is written on both sides, consists of two long skins and a short piece, and goes to the end of the Court held at Akly on the Saturday before All Saints' Day, 1392.

ROW.CELL: Rob'tus Forster Will's Kychon Joh'es Odnell & Will's Wardeley Jur. ad collig' mensur' & ad p'sentand' dicu't q'd nō h'ent co'e bz neqz ve . . . aliqua blad' ib'm nisi ad co'e for' d'ni Regis & hoc per mensur' d'ni Regis ib'm I'o in m' Et h'ent diē ad ordinand. j bz cita f'm Pur' b'te Marie . . . s'b pena iijs. iiijd. Item ibidem j plumbum ponendum in le furnayse, 2 olle ennee, j patell', 1 pelvis, 1 lotorium, et alia minuta, ut secur', penetralia, vange, et tribule.

Baudekennys que venerunt cum d'no Antonio Ep'o.

In primis unum velu. de ij peciis de panno de Tars. Item ij velueth rubei coloris. It. j magnus pannus de auro, qui jacet super tumbam d'ni Antonii diebus festivis. Item ij baudek'n cum Angelis. Item ij de auro, rubei coloris. Item ij de armis d'ni Antonii. It. ij de viridi, cum leonibus, que d'ns Prior habet. It. j pannus de auro viridis coloris. It. j pannus niger de auro. It. j pannus de auro diversi coloris. It. j pannus de serico cum armis d'ni Antonii. It. j di. pannus de auro pro orfrays. It. ij baudk'n que venerunt cum d'no Ric'o Ep'o de dono Regis. It. iij simplic. baudk'n. It. j parvus pannus de auro de colore hynde. It. xij baudk'n invent. in Officio quando suscepit statum.
Memorandum quod dictus Sacrista, ubi solebat recipere de ecclesia de Edlingham quolibet anno 26li. 13s. 4d., jam per quinque annos elapsos nil penitus recepit.
Item, ubi solebat recipere de Bywell quolibet anno 50li., nichil recepit.

Summa, 4xx9li.

DIV2.HEAD: 1322. A mutilated roll "a die Sci. Oswaldi Anno, etc., xxijdo." It contains separate accounts of purchases of wax, wine, oil, fat, Paris candles, and butter, repairs of vestments and in the church, sacrist's expenses for his clothing, and small expenses, his travelling expenses, servants' wages, payment of debts, farming expenses, chiefly "apud le Hogh," e.g., "in ij par de Wayn∣boghes cum aratr' ihockes (sic) empt', 3s.," corn∣account, etc., ending with,
DIV2.P: Alie expense varie et necessarie facte sunt per predictum Sacristam in Ecclesia, in maneriis, et alibi per vices per tempus supranotatum, que sue memorie penitus non occurrunt.

DIV2.HEAD: 1338. Status Sacristar. Dunolm. liberatus et ostensus in Capitulo annali Dunolm. in crastino sancte Fidis virginis, anno Domini Millesimo cccmo tricesimo octavo, per fratrum Thomam de Greystanes, Sacristam Ecclesie Dunolm.
DIV2.P:
In primis in Camera Sacriste sunt xiiij baudekynes. Item ij panni aurei viridis coloris. Item j pannus aureus indici coloris pro tumba domini Antonij ex dimissione ejusdem. Item xviij panni veteres de serico et de baudekyn pendentes super parietes Ecclesie. Item vij panni de serico diversi coloris ex dono domini Regis. Item ij panni de serico ex dono domini Ludovici Episcopi. Item ij baudekynes novi cum armis ipsius domini Ludovici ex dono ejusdem. Item vj panni de serico novi ex dono domini Ricardi de Byri Episcopi. Item j baudekyn ex dono Isolde relicte Radulfi de Whitewell. Item j pannus novus de serico viridis coloris de Kameka de empcione domini Willelmi de Dunolm. Item vij casule veteres pendentes in camera. Item xx ulne de rubeo carde. Item ij pecie de orfrays de filo contexte. Item xxxix ulne linee tele. Item iij uncie serici diversi coloris. Item j superlectile novum de dono domini Ludovici Episcopi coopertum panno serico, et x dorsoria indici coloris, et vij plumaria cooperta serico indici coloris. Item j calix ponderis xxxs., et viginti solidi pro reparacione dicti calicis remanent in manu Roberti de London, aurifabri, famuli Hugonis de Brandon. Item ij missalia defectiva quorum j cum oracionibus tantum. Item j fermaculum aureum ex dono magistri Willelmi de Kellawe pro nova imagine beate Marie, cum uno annulo aureo. Item ij
pomelli argentei pro capis deaurati et an'i'ati (?) Item ij parve capselle cum diversis fragmentis argenti et lapidum que cadebant de ornamentis Ecclesie, in quibus sunt pomelli prescripti. Item ij cruces argentate. Item j remanens de panno aureo pro iij paruris. Item xx griffones aurei pro una capa vel casula. Item j baculus pastoralis de argento, quondam domini Antonij Episcopi Dunolmensis. Item de cera in camera C. l . . . cere xijxxli. preter luminaria circa corpus sancti Cuthberti et super trabem. Item j libra thuris. Item de butyro xj petre. Item vij . . . lampad et vj petre sepi. Item de plumbo jactato et non jactato xxiiijxx petre. Item in cineribus plumbi lx petre. Item de vitro xxv ponderis . . . Item ccc . . . [e]stimat' ix petr. ferri. Item iiijor pelves pro mandato. Item ij corei equini dealbati. (Item) j patella ferri pro opere plumbarii. Item j cabillus magnus et alius minor de canabo de xxxiiij fadomes. Item j cabilus magnus xl cubitorum. Item j hauceour xxx cubitorum. Item j aliud hauceour xvj cubitorum. Item ij warderapes, quarum utraque de xiiij fadomes. Item j par tractuum, ij corde pro carectis, ij corde pro campanis, j tera. Item de oleo lini pro pictura j quarta et dimidium. Item iij libre stampni, j cathedra ferrea, ij pykoys de ferro, j gaveloc, cum iij weggis de ferro, j par de pynceours de ferro. Item j uncus ferreus magnus pro arboribus et lapidibus in altum trahendis, ij incudes, ij martelli. Item j magnus Nailtoll. Nayltoll, 1338, bis. Nayltole, 1343-4. Naylletole, 1345-6. Naultole, 1346-7. Nailtole, 1347-8, 1348-9. Nayltulle, 1349-50. Naytole, 1350-51. Item j magna patella pro cera liquefacienda, j tripes, et j magna pelvis. Item de meremio pro fabrica Ecclesie, xxiiij car'tat. Item de calce, xvj quart'. Item vj scale longe quercine, et iiijor scale minores. Item xvij panelli de bordis de Estland pro armariolo vestimentorum de novo faciendo. Item medietas j dolei vini pro missis celebrandis.

P.HI: Debts owed to and by the office.

DIV2.P: In stabulo Sacriste sunt tres equi, videlt j palefridus et ij hakenays.
"Redd. assise" include "Rekpen".

DIV3.P: Item apud Beaurep' (a few horses).

Item apud le Hough (a long list of oxen, calves, sheep, lambs, geese, ducks, poultry, corn, hay, implements, xij arquill', household vessels and furniture, gardening and other tools, ij scale quercine, unus pannus ventr. iiijor
betours, j solopium, ij mensure que vocantur bussell, iij cribre. Item j armariolum magnum infra manerium, vij copule de syles longitudinis xvj pedum, et iiijor copule de syles longitudinis xxviijto pedum. Item ij tere pro affris.

DIV2.HEAD: Comp. Tho. de Greystanes, 1338-40.
DIV2.P: Arr. et debit., £125 10s. 10d. Particulars given.

Rec. Idem respond. de 40li. 8s. 2d. ob. rec. de iij terminis infra tempus hujus compoti. Et de 13li. 17s. 10d. rec. de denariis fumalibus infra tempus comp. Et de 45s. rec. de fraeria Sci. Cuthberti infra tempus predictum. Et de 6s. rec. de oblacionibus per vices ad hostium Ecclesie.
Summa hujus particule, 56li. 17s. ob.
Idem de 20li. rec. de firma ecclesie de Whiteword, de terminis infra istum compotum. Et de 4s. rec. de proficuis Curie de Landa Dei.
Summa hujus particule, 20li. 4s.
Var. rec. (For cattle, horses, sheep, carcases, hides, tithes of Whitworth sold; "et de 10s. rec. de diversis personis pro dampnis factis apud le Segrestenhough").
Summa de var. rec., 18li. 19s. 8d.
Mutuaciones. Summa, 6li.
Summa tocius recept' preter arrerag' et debit', 102li. 8d. ob.; cum arr. et debit., 227li. 11s. 6d. ob.

Expense. In primis in empcione vini et olei pro ecclesia per tempus compoti, ut patet per particulas, 11li. 4d. In empcione cere, sepi, et bituri pro eadem ecclesia, 21li. 4s. 8d. In empcione plumbi, stanni, et ferri, 4li. 5s. 9d. ob. In minutis expensis factis infra ecclesiam, 59s. 9d. In expensis necessariis factis in officio, 15li. 8d. ob. In expens. latomorum sculpantium lapides pro erectione cujusdam novi butracii ad gabellum Gallilee a die Decollacionis Sci. Joh'is Baptiste usque diem Dominicam prox. ante festum Ap'lor. Philippi et Jacobi, 10li. 16d. In reparacione cujusdam domus pertinentis ad officium Sacriste in Suthstret in Dunolm., 17s. 4d. ob. qa.
